message_1: Consider a sphere with radius 5. Find the maximum number of mutually tangent disks with radius 1 that can be placed on the sphere without overlapping.
message_2:
To find the maximum number of mutually tangent disks with radius 1 that can be placed on a sphere with radius 5 without overlapping, we can use the Tammes problem solution for the case when the radius of the sphere is 5 times the radius of the disks.

The Tammes problem is a mathematical problem that asks for the arrangement of points on the surface of a sphere that maximizes the minimum distance between them. In this case, we are looking for the arrangement of disks with radius 1 on a sphere with radius 5.

The solution to the Tammes problem for the case when the radius of the sphere is 5 times the radius of the disks is 12. This means that the maximum number of mutually tangent disks with radius 1 that can be placed on a sphere with radius 5 without overlapping is 12.
